segments.text: The scene is almost picture-perfect, yet my heart sinks as I observe the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the woman, lost in her own world, completely unaware of the mess unfolding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water pouring over the sink seems to mirror my feelings—overflowing and uncontained.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if she slips? What if the boy falls?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a mix of nostalgia and worry as I watch the children’s antics.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Every little thing—the open window, the garden outside—feels like a contrast to the brewing storm inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how quickly a moment of joy can turn into a memory of regret.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy grips the edge of the counter, his determination to reach cookies almost admirable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s expectation adds to the sweetness, even as the situation becomes increasingly tense.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can something so innocent turn so dangerously reckless?
segments.speaker: PAR
